articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pressed deeper into areas of the central and southern Gaza Strip as they battled Hamas fighters, while Palestinian health officials said on Thursday that Israeli strikes had killed at least 22 people across the enclave.
articles.title: Israeli tanks push deeper into Gaza, as Biden urges peace

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Search efforts off the coast of Sicily for two remaining bodies missing from the sunken yacht belonging to the wife of British tech magnate Mike Lynch were due to resume early on Thursday.
articles.title: Two bodies still missing from Mike Lynch's sunken yacht in Sicily

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Thursday its troops had beaten back an attempt by a Ukrainian force to infiltrate its border in a different region to Kyiv's incursion onto Russian territory, while Ukrainian drones struck near an air base in southern Russia.
articles.title: Russia says it thwarts Ukrainian cross-border raid in new area

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: The daughter of a Jamaican father and Indian mother, both immigrants, Kamala Harris reflects the United States' changing demographics.
articles.title: In Kamala Harris' multiracial roots, U.S. sees its own future

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese prosecutors have indicted a Japanese citizen on suspicion of espionage, China's foreign ministry said on Thursday, without identifying the person.
articles.title: China confirms Japanese citizen indicted on suspicion of espionage

articles.author: Kate Lamb, Ananda Teresia
articles.description: Indonesia's parliament postponed ratifying changes to an elections law on Thursday amid protests in multiple cities, following outcry over legislation seen to strengthen the political influence of outgoing President Joko Widodo.
articles.title: Protests across Indonesia as parliament delays change to election law

articles.author: Anna Koper
articles.description: Poland wants to deepen its cooperation with India in the defence industry, Prime Minister Donald Tusk said on Thursday, as Warsaw seeks to benefit from New Delhi's drive to modernise its armed forces and diversify away from Russian suppliers.
articles.title: As Modi visits Poland, PM Tusk eyes stronger defence industry ties with India

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A fraction of available aid has passed through the Adre border crossing from Chad into Sudan's hunger-ravaged Darfur region this week following a move by the Sudanese army to temporarily lift a ban on deliveries.
articles.title: Aid trucks trickle into Darfur as army pauses delivery ban

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in St Petersburg have detained an Israeli-Canadian racing car driver wanted by the United States for alleged large-scale fraud relating to an illegal online stock trading scheme, the city's court system said on Wednesday evening.
articles.title: Russia detains Israeli-Canadian citizen wanted in US for fraud

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: A United Nations team will meet Bangladesh's interim government and other stakeholders from Thursday to discuss the process to investigate alleged human rights violations during the recent deadly violence in the South Asian country, officials said.
articles.title: UN team in Bangladesh to discuss modalities of human rights probe
